de.esoco.lib.property

Class AbstractStringProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.property.AbstractStringProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasProperties, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StringProperties

    public abstract class AbstractStringProperties
extends java.lang.Object
implements HasProperties, java.io.Serializable
    A base class for classes that provide access to string-based properties. A directly usable implementation that provides mutable properties can be found in the class StringProperties.

    The internal property map of the base implementation will initially be NULL to save space for empty property objects. Subclasses must handle the case of a NULL map returned by getPropertyMap() appropriately and may explicitly set the map to NULL (through setPropertyMap(Map) to indicate an empty map. The method ensurePropertyMapExists() can be invoked to force the creation of a property map before accessing it.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getPropertyMap

        protected final java.util.Map<PropertyName<?>,java.lang.String> getPropertyMap()
        Returns the property map of this instance. The returned value may be NULL if no properties have been set in this instance. Invoking method must handle this case accordingly.
        Returns:
        The property map or NULL for none

        Returns:
        A new collection of the given type containing the parsed entries
